title: Food additives and hyperactive behaviour in 3-year-old and 8/9-year-old children in the community
notes: Southampton trial: mixtures of synthetic colours plus sodium benzoate increased hyperactivity scores in children.

title: Consideration of the new UK study on behavioural changes in children associated with the ingestion of certain food colours and sodium benzoate
notes: EFSA opinion on the Southampton study; led to EU warning labels for certain azo dyes.

title: Health risk assessment of benzene in beverages sampled in 2007
notes: Regulatory assessment confirming benzoate+ascorbic acid can form benzene in drinks; levels usually low but monitored.

title: Analysis and reduction of benzene in beverages: effects of heat and storage
organisation_or_journal: Journal of Food Composition and Analysis
notes: Experimental work on benzene formation from benzoate and ascorbic acid in drinks.

title: Re-evaluation of potassium nitrite (E 249) and sodium nitrite (E 250) as food additives
notes: Discusses nitrosamine formation from nitrite and associated cancer risk.

title: Carcinogenicity of consumption of red and processed meat
notes: IARC classification of processed meat as Group 1 carcinogen; nitrosamines from nitrite curing are a key mechanism.

title: Adverse reactions to the sulphite additives
notes: Review of sulphite sensitivity; estimates 3–10% of asthmatics react to sulphites.

title: Sulphites and Airway Symptoms Factsheet
notes: Summarises sulphite-related airway symptoms and common food sources.

title: Artificial sweeteners and risk of cardiovascular diseases: results from the NutriNet-Santé cohort
notes: Higher total artificial sweetener intake, often from multiple sweeteners, associated with increased cardiovascular risk.

title: Use of non-sugar sweeteners: WHO guideline
notes: WHO guideline advising against long-term use of non-sugar sweeteners for weight control.

title: Dietary emulsifiers impact the mouse gut microbiota promoting colitis and metabolic syndrome
notes: In mice, carboxymethylcellulose and polysorbate-80 provoke gut inflammation and metabolic syndrome via microbiota changes.

title: Dietary emulsifiers directly alter human microbiota composition and gene expression ex vivo
notes: Shows emulsifiers directly increase pro-inflammatory potential of human microbiota.

title: Caffeine ingestion impairs insulin sensitivity in a dose-dependent manner in both men and women
notes: Demonstrates that caffeine leads to higher glucose and insulin responses, supporting concern about caffeine+high sugar drinks.

title: Energy drinks and their impact on the cardiovascular system
notes: Reviews haemodynamic effects of energy drinks, including roles of caffeine and sugar.

title: A combination of caffeine and taurine induces changes in heart rate and blood pressure
notes: Shows that caffeine+taurine changes cardiovascular parameters versus control.

title: Randomized trial of energy drink versus caffeine alone on blood pressure and ECG parameters
organisation_or_journal: Journal of the American Heart Association
notes: Energy drink produced greater blood pressure and QTc changes than caffeine alone.

title: High dietary phosphate intake induces hypertension via central FGF receptor signalling
notes: Demonstrates phosphate-induced hypertension via FGF23-driven sympathetic activation.

title: High dietary phosphate intake induces hypertension and disrupts baroreflex function in rats
notes: Earlier work linking high phosphate diets to increased blood pressure and sympathetic activity.
